content.body: Mathieu Hofman: did you have a proof of concept for the object reference leak for `Error.prepareStackTrace`? i'm trying to write a counterexample and am not sure how it's possible, actually

content.body: because wrapped functions (in both directions) throw fresh TypeErrors if the wrapped function throws, the fresh TypeErrors don't have outside stacks anyway

content.body: as specced today it doesn't seem to me like we can ever get striped stacks at all, just because of how it falls out of the fresh error creation
